commit_message:
Reduce IP link show calls for SR-IOV scan loop

The device scanning logic was calling 'ip link show' for every
vf_index on the system, which was taking an excessive amount of
time an CPU cycles on very dense SR-IOV servers (>64 interfaces).
This was being executed every 2 seconds so it would cause the
agent to take a large percentage of the CPU time.

This patch adjusts the logic to use two 'ip link show' commands for
checking all of the operations in a single get_assigned_devices_info
call.

Closes-Bug: #1653880
Change-Id: I361caaf7f70580ee8c7b48a4a9c9477bdefd8b4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/00/416400/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def link_show(cls): try: out = cls._execute([], "link", ("show", ), run_as_root=True) except Exception as e: LOG.error(_LE("Failed executing ip command: %s"), e) raise exc.IpCommandError(reason=e) return out @classmethod def is_macvtap_assigned(cls, ifname, ip_link_show_output=None): @param ip_link_show_output: 'ip link show' result to use instead of executing the command in this function. out = ip_link_show_output or cls.link_show()
deleted_lines: def is_macvtap_assigned(cls, ifname): try: out = cls._execute([], "link", ("show", ), run_as_root=True) except Exception as e: LOG.error(_LE("Failed executing ip command: %s"), e) raise exc.IpCommandError(reason=e)

subject: Set fernet max_active_keys to 2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 18:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/ff95ae6fec5083e6811983533bb5e9fd21a236b2', 'message': 'Set fernet max_active_keys to 2

We only seem to be deploying two fernet keys, but the default in
keystone is to have a max active keys of 3.  This results in the
keystone log being spammed with:

Loaded 2 Fernet keys from /etc/keystone/fernet-keys, but
`[fernet_tokens] max_active_keys = 3`; perhaps there have not been
enough key rotations to reach `max_active_keys` yet?

Reducing max_active_keys to 2 should clean that up.

Change-Id: I3259dc8c8097717d65edfb9ebe77add6796a81f0
'}]
commit_message:
Set fernet max_active_keys to 2

We only seem to be deploying two fernet keys, but the default in
keystone is to have a max active keys of 3.  This results in the
keystone log being spammed with:

Loaded 2 Fernet keys from /etc/keystone/fernet-keys, but
`[fernet_tokens] max_active_keys = 3`; perhaps there have not been
enough key rotations to reach `max_active_keys` yet?

Reducing max_active_keys to 2 should clean that up.

Change-Id: I3259dc8c8097717d65edfb9ebe77add6796a81f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/77/412577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keystone::fernet_max_active_keys: 2

commit_message:
Adding debug trace to IPWrapper.get_devices()

This patch adds a debug trace to the get_devices() method due to some
jobs failing in gate (especifically functional test for netns_cleanup).
From gate logs, looks like rootwrap_daemon is returning the output of
the previous command and this trace is to make sure what the actual
output is.

Change-Id: I83c59b9f0ae1ab51f166f442d99a1022e88d808e
Related-Bug: #1654287

commit_message:
Remove duplicated key

The ironic_openstack_driver_list key is being defined twice. This
results in a warning during task execution and the adoption of the
last defined value.

Removing the first defined value here to maintain current behavior.
If the desired behavior is the opposite, I will reinstate the first
and delete the second.

Change-Id: I0f7526230c5192611daefb1934b627aef463f053

commit_message:
Bring consistency to tags

Some tags were not applied on the highest level and forced duplication.
We apply here our practices to have role_name-(config|install).

commit_message:
Do no create Alarm when triggers not part of policies

Alarm is not needed when triggers are not provided under the TOSCA
policies type.

Change-Id: I2f4165d90e5bfc88c31ea90cf45b1478c4b17563

commit_message:
DHCP: "reserved_dhcp_port" not well managed during startup

During DHCP agent startup, same reserved DHCP port can be configured by
2 different DHCP agent (HA case).
In this special error case (race condition case) a DhcpPortInUse
RemoteError exception is triggered (Bug: #1425402).

This exception is actually not caught well, instead of trying with the
next "reserved DHCP port" an exception was raised.

Change-Id: I40cb8884b36c4a7c14f470d3a126f4a9a0a98d47
Closes-bug: #1651512

commit_message:
Introduce API Decorators

Decorators will be used for backwards compatibility with
API v1. Will be needed when doing translations for alignment
of V2 API with LBaaSv2

Change-Id: If98e4dd2b667149b7404a6378e798537684d405d
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sindhu Devale <sindhu.devale@intel.com>

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Intel Corp # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Borrowed from nova code base, more utilities will be added/borrowed as and # when needed. """Decorators to provide backwards compatibility for V1 API.""" def rename_kwargs(**renamed_kwargs): """Renames a class's variables and maintains backwards compatibility. :param renamed_kwargs: mapping of old kwargs to new kwargs. For example, to say a class has renamed variable foo to bar the decorator would be used like: rename_kwargs(foo='bar') """ def wrap(cls): def __getattr__(instance, name): if name in renamed_kwargs: return getattr(instance, renamed_kwargs[name]) return getattr(instance, name) def __setattr__(instance, name, value): if name in renamed_kwargs: instance.__dict__[renamed_kwargs[name]] = value else: instance.__dict__[name] = value def wrapped_cls(*args, **kwargs): for old_kwarg, new_kwarg in renamed_kwargs.items(): if old_kwarg in kwargs: kwargs[new_kwarg] = kwargs[old_kwarg] del kwargs[old_kwarg] cls.__getattr__ = __getattr__ cls.__setattr__ = __setattr__ return cls(*args, **kwargs) return wrapped_cls return wrap @rename_kwargs(a='z') class C(object): def __init__(self, x, z=None): self.x = x self.z = z def log_reads(instance): print("instance.a = %d" % instance.a) print("instance.z = %d" % instance.z) print("instance.x = %d" % instance.x) def set_attribute(instance, attribute): print("Setting instance.%s = 4" % attribute) setattr(instance, attribute, 4) if __name__ == '__main__': print("Passing old parameters to class: C(1, a=3)") old_style = C(1, a=3) log_reads(old_style) set_attribute(old_style, 'a') log_reads(old_style) print("\nPassing new parameters to class: C(1, z=5)") new_style = C(1, z=5) log_reads(new_style) set_attribute(new_style, 'z') log_reads(new_style)

subject: Remove percona repo if not used
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-06 12:10:32.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/make-sure-the-repo-is-removed-if-not-used-36670d0a276192f1.yaml', 'tasks/galera_install_apt.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/commit/2aa7f1ca8ac399b71bc3d106d9548aafdca2a663', 'message': "Remove percona repo if not used

If the ``use_percona_upstream`` value is changed from True to False,
don't remove the existing repository. This is also the source of a bug
in Mitaka: We were installing the repo by default and installed the
percona-xtrabackup tool with a deb file. If another playbook/role
installed percona-xtrabackup, it would override (and probably upgrade)
the deb installed version, which is undesired.

Change-Id: I2ccc2904d0d4244dc0792411b49763cc3f7e2e22
Closes-Bug: 1653947
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
Remove percona repo if not used

If the ``use_percona_upstream`` value is changed from True to False,
don't remove the existing repository. This is also the source of a bug
in Mitaka: We were installing the repo by default and installed the
percona-xtrabackup tool with a deb file. If another playbook/role
installed percona-xtrabackup, it would override (and probably upgrade)
the deb installed version, which is undesired.

Change-Id: I2ccc2904d0d4244dc0792411b49763cc3f7e2e22
Closes-Bug: 1653947
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Wrap invalidation region to context-local cache

Since we started to use invalidation strategy, region_id of cache
is stored in cache itself in a special region. This requires fetching
region id from memcached, which might be slow. In order to prevent
unnecessary lookups of region id, wrap the code in request-local
cache, which is very fast.

This change increases performance and doesn't fix functionality
bugs.

Closes-Bug: 1641652

Change-Id: I386cf15c51f88ac4a733ec357f62ebebda8d3699

deleted_lines: def test_singular_methods_when_invalidating_the_region(self): key = uuid.uuid4().hex value = uuid.uuid4().hex # key does not exist self.assertIsInstance(self.region0.get(key), dogpile.NoValue) # make it exist self.region0.set(key, value) # ensure it exists self.assertEqual(value, self.region0.get(key)) # invalidating region1 should invalidate region0 self.region1.invalidate() self.assertIsInstance(self.region0.get(key), dogpile.NoValue) def test_multi_methods_when_invalidating_the_region(self): mapping = {uuid.uuid4().hex: uuid.uuid4().hex for _ in range(4)} keys = list(mapping.keys()) values = [mapping[k] for k in keys] # keys do not exist self._assert_has_no_value(self.region0.get_multi(keys)) # make them exist self.region0.set_multi(mapping) # ensure they exist self.assertEqual(values, self.region0.get_multi(keys)) # check using the singular get method for completeness self.assertEqual(mapping[keys[0]], self.region0.get(keys[0])) # invalidating region1 should invalidate region0 self.region1.invalidate() # ensure they are gone self._assert_has_no_value(self.region0.get_multi(keys)) def test_memoize_decorator_when_invalidating_the_region(self): memoize = cache.get_memoization_decorator('cache', region=self.region0) @memoize def func(value): return value + uuid.uuid4().hex key = uuid.uuid4().hex # test get/set return_value = func(key) # the values should be the same since it comes from the cache self.assertEqual(return_value, func(key)) # invalidating region1 should invalidate region0 self.region1.invalidate() new_value = func(key) self.assertNotEqual(return_value, new_value) def test_combination(self): memoize = cache.get_memoization_decorator('cache', region=self.region0) @memoize def func(value): return value + uuid.uuid4().hex key = uuid.uuid4().hex simple_value = uuid.uuid4().hex # test get/set using the decorator return_value = func(key) self.assertEqual(return_value, func(key)) # test get/set using the singular methods self.region0.set(key, simple_value) self.assertEqual(simple_value, self.region0.get(key)) # invalidating region1 should invalidate region0 self.region1.invalidate() # ensure that the decorated function returns a new value new_value = func(key) self.assertNotEqual(return_value, new_value) # ensure that a get doesn't have a value self.assertIsInstance(self.region0.get(key), dogpile.NoValue) def test_direct_region_key_invalidation(self): """Invalidate by manually clearing the region key's value. NOTE(dstanek): I normally don't like tests that repeat application logic, but in this case we need to. There are too many ways that the tests above can erroneosly pass that we need this sanity check. """ region_key = cache.RegionInvalidationManager( None, self.region0.name)._region_key key = uuid.uuid4().hex value = uuid.uuid4().hex # key does not exist self.assertIsInstance(self.region0.get(key), dogpile.NoValue) # make it exist self.region0.set(key, value) # ensure it exists self.assertEqual(value, self.region0.get(key)) # test invalidation cache.CACHE_INVALIDATION_REGION.delete(region_key) self.assertIsInstance(self.region0.get(key), dogpile.NoValue)

subject: Caching info in the instance discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-13 18:19:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/d80b776428aad2ac3b71a126cdf95b04d70707e9', 'message': "[WIP] [PoC] Caching metadata of compute pollster

This patchset is hacked PoC
for spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209799/.

This implementation uses a next main approaches:
* using redis for caching metadata. I choose redis,
because we still don't know what count of metadata entries
is enough for this spec: only last or we should
save last n metadatas with timestamps and oslo.cache doesn't support sets.

* getting all instances from hypervisor and choosing only ones
which have a metadata into the cache. Only libvirt is supported now.
New discovery have been created for this.

* samples are combined from measures and metadata in the pollsters.

* metadata collected via instance metric discovery and instance notifications

Next points:

* make better a discovery for instances metric and instance notifications
(now it's hacky)

* trying to save a metadata in the set

* change a mechanism of combining measures and metrics

* Other improvements

Change-Id: I62d6dfd4cff5b167c5dfd8a0440db7c5a522ac5a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-18 19:49:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/f6c62b8c446b878ba4839d7b8e1a4d51ca727a0f', 'message': '[WIP] [PoC] Caching metadata of compute pollster

This patchset is hacked PoC
for spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209799/.

This implementation uses a next main approaches:
* now it support oslo.cache for collecting data, but it will be not usefull
if we set up a "memory" (local) cache backend

* getting all instances from hypervisor and choosing only ones
which have a metadata into the cache. Only libvirt is supported now.
New discovery have been created for this.

* measures are extended by metadata during the discovery and it works one by
polling interval

* samples are combined from measures and metadata in the pollsters.

* metadata collected via instance metric discovery and instance notifications

* pipeline have been changed to run a instance polling less often than other cpu
pollsters

* Now I use a lookUpByUUID in libvirt, but I think operations on the libvirt
domains are preferred on the large compute nodes
because we avoid an instance searching

* Agent manager and notification agent have a same cache fields and methods
and I think it's better to move these attributes to the ceilometer.cache

Next points:

* trying to save a metadata in the set

* Other improvements

Change-Id: I62d6dfd4cff5b167c5dfd8a0440db7c5a522ac5a

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-10 12:31:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/ac1f0426c3152862e965e31976f1aa582cc53c80', 'message': "[WIP] Caching info in the instance discovery

This change request adds a possbility to use a global caching
for the instances discovery.
User can turn on global cache for compute discovery with
configuring of [cache] group and defining enable_global_cache=True
in the [compute] group. Also, global cache requires a distributed
lock enabling for the cache backend.

New workflow periodically cache instances info to the global cache
and for the every polling interval it combine all instances by host
from the hypervisor with cache info.

Caching could be started from the every compute agent and
it collects info about all instances at the deployment and pushes
it to the cache. For synchronization distributed lock by const
lock name is used.

According to the fact what we use a `change_since` search option
for the collect instances list, instances info doesn't expires,
only resource updating lock can be expired.

Implements: improve-nova-instance-metering
Change-Id: I62d6dfd4cff5b167c5dfd8a0440db7c5a522ac5a
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-10 14:13:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/10c6007f58f0d4bb4f9678a1d17affcf97ef7ba8', 'message': "[WIP] Caching info in the instance discovery

Caching could be started from the every compute agent and
it collects info about all instances at the deployment and pushes
it to the cache. For synchronization distributed lock by const
lock name is used.

According to the fact what we use a `change_since` search option
for the collect instances list, instances info doesn't expires,
only resource updating lock can be expired.

Implements: improve-nova-instance-metering
Change-Id: I62d6dfd4cff5b167c5dfd8a0440db7c5a522ac5a

commit_message:
Caching info in the instance discovery

This change request adds a possbility to use a global caching
for the instances discovery.
User can turn on global cache for compute discovery with
configuring of [cache] group and defining enable_global_cache=True
in the [compute] group. Also, global cache requires a distributed
lock enabling for the cache backend.

New workflow periodically cache instances info to the global cache
and for the every polling interval it combine all instances by host
from the hypervisor with cache info.

Caching could be started from the every compute agent and
it collects info about all instances at the deployment and pushes
it to the cache. For synchronization distributed lock by const
lock name is used.

According to the fact what we use a `change_since` search option
for the collect instances list, instances info doesn't expires,
only resource updating lock can be expired.

Implements: improve-nova-instance-metering
Change-Id: I62d6dfd4cff5b167c5dfd8a0440db7c5a522ac5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/78/267078/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonfrom ceilometer import cache self._very = [] self.cache_connection = cache.get_cache_client() def cache_metadata(self, resource_id, user_id=None, project_id=None, metadata=None): message = json.dumps({"metadata": metadata or {}, "user_id": user_id, "project_id": project_id}) self.cache_connection.set(resource_id, message)

commit_message:
[ES] Implement event time to live

Now elasticsearch backend doesn't support time to live configuration.
In current patchset this functional has been added.
TTL mechanism for es affects only new events. It's implemented via two ways:
- Creating new index templates for future indexes
- Changing mapping for every existing index

Also, mechanism for deleting expired day indices is implemented
in this CR. After `ceilometer-expirer` running it founds all expired
indices by name and delete it via elasticsearch calls.

Closes-bug: #1489869
Change-Id: Ia110b199396705c9b47c4eb1cdd91590d7478a42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/73/200573/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_config import cfgfrom ceilometer.i18n import _, _LE, _LI # NOTE(ityaptin) TTL in elasticsearch is a positive milliseconds number self.ttl = max(cfg.CONF.database.event_time_to_live, 0) * 1000 or None '_ttl': {'enabled': True}, # NOTE(ityaptin) updating mapping for old indices try: iclient.put_mapping('_default_', ts_template['mappings']['_default_'], '%s_*' % self.index_name) except es.NotFoundError: LOG.debug(_("Indices does not exist yet. " "Nothing need to upgrade.")) 'raw': ev.raw}, '_ttl': self.ttl, }

commit_message:
Enable test env services

We want the testenv services to come back up when the
te server is restarted.

Change-Id: I5a1ec9ffa88dde79a97c87db2b5f104729c01db2

commit_message:
Add deprecated_option_warning() method to Command

This method factors out a common pattern for handling deprecated
command options.

Change-Id: I8ca8ec76365833cc8a71388e478680f7f8444be0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/65/416665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def deprecated_option_warning(self, old_option, new_option): """Emit a warning for use of a deprecated option""" self.log.warning( _("The %(old)s option is deprecated, please use %(new)s instead.") % {'old': old_option, 'new': new_option} )

commit_message:
Update docstring at test_sql_upgrade

Since the tests are using oslo.db tests, we no longer use the
settings at backend_sql.conf file at "test_sql_upgrade". Updating the
docstring to point to oslo.db unit tests documentation.

Change-Id: Iae805113921cc872ec158b7878b14ef4d63e8982

commit_message:
Set up the auth to handle V3 keystone as well

This is for the scenario tests, as it only affects the
compat client.

Change-Id: If827e1bcefcf686e7e905df09e96a4eac9e85abf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/33/408333/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return KeyStoneAuthenticator service_url=None, domain_name=None): self.domain_name = domain_name or 'Default' if resp.status in [200, 201]: # content must always present root_key=root_key, resp=resp)class KeyStoneAuthenticator(Authenticator): if '/v2.0' in self.url: return self._v2_auth(self.url) return self._v3_auth(self.url) def _v3_auth(self, url): """Authenticate against a v3 auth service.""" identity = { "methods": ["password"], "password": { "user": { "name": self.username, "domain": { "name": self.domain_name, }, "password": self.password, }, }, } body = { "auth": { "identity": identity, }, } if self.tenant: scope = { "project": { "name": self.tenant, "domain": { "name": self.domain_name, }, } } body["auth"]["scope"] = scope return self._authenticate(url, body, root_key='token') service_name=None, service_url=None, root_key='access', resp=None): self.resp = resp if 'token' in self.catalog[self.root_key]: return self.catalog[self.root_key]['token']['id'] return self.resp.get('x-subject-token') catalog_key = {'access': 'serviceCatalog', 'token': 'catalog'}[self.root_key] endpoint_type = {'access': {'publicURL': 'publicURL', 'adminURL': 'adminURL', 'internalURL': 'internalURL', }, 'token': {'publicURL': 'public', 'adminURL': 'admin', 'internalURL': 'internal', }, }[self.root_key][endpoint_type] endpoint_attr_name = (endpoint_type if 'URL' in endpoint_type else 'url') if catalog_key not in self.catalog[self.root_key]: catalog = self.catalog[self.root_key][catalog_key] if ((not filter_value or endpoint.get(attr) == filter_value) and ('URL' not in endpoint_type and endpoint['interface'] == endpoint_type)): return matching_endpoints[0].get(endpoint_attr_name, None)
deleted_lines: return KeyStoneV2Authenticator service_url=None): if resp.status == 200: # content must always present root_key=root_key)class KeyStoneV2Authenticator(Authenticator): return self._v2_auth(self.url) service_name=None, service_url=None, root_key='access'): return self.catalog[self.root_key]['token']['id'] if 'serviceCatalog' not in self.catalog[self.root_key]: catalog = self.catalog[self.root_key]['serviceCatalog'] if not filter_value or endpoint.get(attr) == filter_value: return matching_endpoints[0].get(endpoint_type, None)

subject: Bump SQLAlchemy UC to 1.1.4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 20:30:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/b47bfd912a8e0391916905327925c5fb81f731e3', 'message': 'Bump SQLAlchemy UC to 1.1.4

When installing devstack and error sometimes occurs running
dbsync on the cinder dtabase:

ERROR oslo_db.sqlalchemy.exc_filters ProgrammingError: (1064, u"You have
an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your
MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '(6)' at line 1")

This seems to happen when running SQLAlchemy 1.0.16 but does not occur
with 1.1.4

This change moves the upper-constraints.txt value for SQLAlchemy
to 1.1.4 to remedy thie issue.

Note: There may be an issue with the bot, since the SQLAlchemy page
lists both 1.0.16 and 1.1.4 in its index and the bot chooses the 1.0.x
version.

commit_message:
Bump SQLAlchemy UC to 1.1.4

When installing devstack and error sometimes occurs running
dbsync on the cinder dtabase:

ERROR oslo_db.sqlalchemy.exc_filters ProgrammingError: (1064, u"You have
an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your
MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '(6)' at line 1")

This seems to happen when running SQLAlchemy 1.0.16 but does not occur
with 1.1.4

This change moves the upper-constraints.txt value for SQLAlchemy
to 1.1.4 to remedy thie issue.

Note: There may be an issue with the bot, since the SQLAlchemy page
lists both 1.0.16 and 1.1.4 in its index and the bot chooses the 1.0.x
version.

Change-Id: I48c70d2cec8113f03e4180ed587ad8ee1623061c

commit_message:
[WIP] Add scale to roles gate

Adding scale feature to the roles gating pipeline

Change-Id: If0de7b41de67976a92ad210e31d3b25e5181f2e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/42/329542/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # run scale phase 1 against the gate job: Deploy -> Validate -> Scale new compute node -> Delete original compute node bash $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/quickstart.sh \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --no-clone \ --bootstrap \ --requirements $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/quickstart-role-requirements.txt \ -e undercloud_image_url="http://artifacts.ci.centos.org/artifacts/rdo/images/$RELEASE/$BUILD_SYS/$LOCATION/undercloud.qcow2" \ --config $WORKSPACE/config/general_config/scale_compute.yml \ --playbook scale_nodes.yml --tags all \ $VIRTHOST $RELEASE # run scale phase 2 against the gate job: Re-inventory overcloud -> Validate # Note(hrybacki): The reason we need seperate playbook execution: During scale we create # one /additional/ compute node and then delete the /original/ compute node. # The deleted node is still in memory and subsequently will cause issues # while re-inventorying and validating the overcloud bash $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/quickstart.sh \ --working-dir $WORKSPACE/ \ --retain-inventory \ --no-clone \ --requirements $WORKSPACE/tripleo-quickstart/quickstart-role-requirements.txt \ -e undercloud_image_url="http://artifacts.ci.centos.org/artifacts/rdo/images/$RELEASE/$BUILD_SYS/$LOCATION/undercloud.qcow2" \ --config $WORKSPACE/config/general_config/scale_compute.yml \ --playbook scale_nodes_verify.yml --tags all \ $VIRTHOST $RELEASE

commit_message:
[WIP] - Add basic documentation for overcloud-upgrade role

Porting work by apetrich[1] done in the older art-overcloud-upgrade
role to the newer quickstart-extras repository.

- Major re-write of pre-overcloud.yml
  - port whatever can be to templated bash
  - move templated bash script generation to it's own task file
  - review hotfixes and remove as needed

[1] - https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/289994/

Change-Id: Ie3929f72ebd2a9d42f596b5d754967ff703a1eed

deleted_lines: # Undercloud upgrade script. # Those steps is for the major mariadb upgrade in mitaka

commit_message:
Added separate interface for rabbitmq

Enable rabbitmq to listen on different interface when hostname
not based on api_interface

Closes-bug: #1583655
Change-Id: Ife118dc9e4281e7be789671acdde61791576e250
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/57/401957/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: transport_url = rabbit://{% for host in groups['rabbitmq'] %}{{ rabbitmq_user }}:{{ rabbitmq_password }}@{% if orchestration_engine == 'KUBERNETES' %}rabbitmq{% else %}{{ hostvars[host]['ansible_' + hostvars[host]['rabbitmq_interface']]['ipv4']['address'] }}{% endif %}:{{ rabbitmq_port }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}
deleted_lines: transport_url = rabbit://{% for host in groups['rabbitmq'] %}{{ rabbitmq_user }}:{{ rabbitmq_password }}@{% if orchestration_engine == 'KUBERNETES' %}rabbitmq{% else %}{{ hostvars[host]['ansible_' + hostvars[host]['api_interface']]['ipv4']['address'] }}{% endif %}:{{ rabbitmq_port }}{% if not loop.last %},{% endif %}{% endfor %}

commit_message:
Generic power interface for soft reboot and soft power off

This patch updates the generic power interface to support SOFT_REBOOT
and SOFT_POWER_OFF. And also it introduces "timeout" optional
parameter for all power operations.

Partial-Bug: #1526226
Change-Id: I1c9bbd1f11f6a8565607c874b3c99aa10eeb62a5

commit_message:
DVR: Fix race condition in creation of fip gateway

In large-scale environments, we have seen a router update
arrive for one tenant while we are still creating the
router for a different tenant and initializing the shared
floating IP gateway port.  Sometimes these updates can
get scheduled simultaneously, with the second running
before we are done creating all the resources in the
first, causing an exception when trying to set the
default route since either the interface or IP address
does not exist yet.

Add a lock to better synchronize these functions so
a create can finish before an update can be done.

If it still fails, we will throw an exception so that
the namespace will be cleaned-up and the update can be
re-scheduled for the next iteration.

Closes-Bug: #1631513
(cherry picked from commit d40322c7d4aa1dd6d595dfe415278c9f252f4da2)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Change-Id: Ia8c92cea2f8798582c39ad3450ab3b3c45a356f7

commit_message:
Collect the deploy.env and annotate appended sections

Saving this will be useful for debugging, and to grab when you want to run
deploy.sh locally. We also put the caller as a comment in the file
as it's appended with every call to echo_vars_to_deploy_env so it's easier
to see where mutations to the environment happen, and what to remove
when running deploy.sh locally.

Change-Id: I7470c8a5a539c50d05342ac57e176156cb8ec0ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/30/414630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add novajoin class

In this commit, we add the puppet module for a new
nova metadata micro-service (novajoin) that allows nova
instances to be registered to a FreeIPA server as IPA clients.

Implements: blueprint novajoin

Nova. Let's do it.
